SourceText: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. üå±
text: Lesi sifundo simayelana nokuzinakekela. üå±

SourceText: It is normal to feel stressed as your child develops. As they grow, your relationship changes. To handle this change smoothly, you must care for yourself.
text: Kungokwemvelo ukuzizwa ucindezelekile njengoba ingane yakho ikhula. Njengoba zikhula, ubudlelwano benu buyashintsha. Ukuze ubhekane nalolu shintsho ngokushelela, kufanele uzinakekele.

SourceText: Self-care is an activity you do for yourself so you feel better and less stressed. üíö
text: Ukuzinakekela kuyinto ozenzela yona ukuze uzizwe ungcono futhi ungacindezeleki kangako. üíö

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èCindezela la kuthi khona dlala ukuze uthole okungakusiza kwingcindezi.

SourceText: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
text: Nakhu ongakwenza okulula mayelana nokuzelula nokunyakazisa umzimba wakho okungakusiza mayelana nengcindezi yakho:

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky.
text: Sukuma bese welulela izingalo zakho phezulu esibhakabhakeni.

SourceText: Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you.
text: Dudula amafu ukuze ilanga likukhanyisele.

SourceText: Stretch to both sides.
text: Zelulele kuwo womabili amacala.

SourceText: Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Zelulele phambili nangemuva.

SourceText: Let your hands hang by your side.
text: Lengisela izandla zakho emaceleni.

SourceText: Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath.
text: Donsa umoya ukhuphule amahlombe akho ngesikhathi udonsa umoya, ucimezisise kakhulu amehlo akho, ubambe umoya wakho.

SourceText: Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
text: Yehlisa amahlombe akho ngesikhathi uyethisa umzimba wakho.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
text: Zikhulule izingalo zakho futhi uzivumele ziye phambili nasemuva. Donsa umoya uwukhiphe kane ngenkathi wenza lokhu. Lokhu kuyayisiza ingxenye yomgogodla engezansi.

SourceText: Relax your arms, let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Zikhulule izingalo zakho, zishwibele emaceleni, futhi uphendule ingxenye engenhle yomzimba wakho. Izingalo zakho kufanele zishaye kancane emhlane wakho njengoba usonteleka ngapha nangapha.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles. Remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olulodwa phambi kolunye futhi urawundise amaqakala kancane. Khumbula ukuwaphendulela kuzo zombili izinhlangothi. Phendulela unyawo ngalunye izikhathi ezine ohlangothini ngalunye.

SourceText: Now, shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Manje, nyakazisa wonke umzimba wakho ngokushesha ngangokunokwenzeka. Unyakazise phezulu! Unyakazise phansi! Unyakazise nxazonke!

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Vala amehlo akho bese uphakamisela phezulu izingalo zakho kancane ukwedlula ikhanda ube udonsa umoya kancane. Yehlisela izingalo zakho emaceleni kancane ngesikhathi ukhipha umoya.

SourceText: Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out 4 more times.
text: Phakamisa futhi wehlise izingalo zakho, donsa umoya uwukhiphe izikhathi ezingu-4 ezengeziwe.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Ithi ukuma kancane emva kokwenza lokhu.

SourceText: Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Khumbula ukuthi ungakwenza lokhu nganoma yisiphi isikhathi nanoma nini lapho uzwa sengathi ufuna ukukhipha i-stress nokuvuselela ingqondo yakho nomzimba wakho.

text: Umsebenzi Wasekhaya! Zama ukwelula nokuhamba okungenani kanye ngosuku. Ungakwazi ukukuzama lokhu khona manje?

SourceText: Excellent. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference in how you feel each day. ‚≠ê
text: Nazoke. Ukunyakaza kuwulungele umzimbeni wakho futhi kwenza umehluko endleleni ozizwa ngayo usuku ngalunye. ‚≠ê

SourceText: That‚Äôs okay. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference to how you feel each day. ‚≠ê
text: Kulungile. Ukunyakazisa umzimba kuyinto enhle mayelana nomzimba wakho futhi kwenza umehluko ngendlela ozizwa ngayo usuku nosuku. ‚≠ê

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} wants to spend more time helping her son, {F3_SON_4}, learn by playing together. Let‚Äôs see how both of them do it:
text: {F3_MOTHER} ufuna ukuchitha isikhathi esengeziwe esiza indodana yakhe, {F3_SON_4}, fundani ngokudlala ndawonye. Ake sibone ukuthi bobabili bakwenza kanjani:

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúHi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúSawubona, sithandwa sami. Ungathanda senze okuthile okujabulisayo ndawonye?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOoooh yes!‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOoooh yebo!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúUngathanda ukwenzani?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúBuild a house out of bed sheets!‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúUkwakha indlu ngamashidi ombhede!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúGreat idea! What do we need to do first?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúUmqondo omuhle! Singaqala kuphi?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúFirst, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It‚Äôs our first wall! We can use clothing pins to keep up the sheet.‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOkokuqala, sihenga ishidi elilodwa lombhede kulo mbhede ongaphezulu. Lokhu kuzoba udonga lwethu lokuqala! Singasebenzisa ophini ukuze sibophe ngalo ishidi.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, well done for thinking through the steps so carefully.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWawu, waze wazicabanga ngokucophelela izinto esizozenza.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúThis is a wonderful bedsheet house, {F3_SON_4}‚Äù!
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúLe yindlu enhle yamashidi, {F3_SON_4}‚Äù!

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúCan we read our bedtime story here tonight?‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúSingakwazi ukufunda indaba yethu ngaphambi kokulala namuhla kusihlwa?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYes, of course, {F3_SON_4}. That will be fun.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYebo, kunjalo, {F3_SON_4}. Lokho kuzoba mnandi.‚Äù

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} is helping his children, {F1_SON_5} and {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, learn how to play soccer and interact with each other well:
text: U{F1_FATHER} usiza izingane zakhe, u{F1_SON_5} kanye no{F1_DAUGHTER_6}, bafunde ukudlala ibhola nokusebenzisana kahle:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGently kick the ball using the inside of your foot, like this.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúKhahlela kahle ibhola usebenzisa ingaphakathi lonyawo lwakho, kanje.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúI want to do it now!!‚Äù
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúNgifuna ukukwenza manje!!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúNo, I want to do it first!!‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúCha, ngifuna ukukwenza kuqala!!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúIt can be hard to wait, but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, can you suggest a way for us to take turns kicking the ball?**

SourceText: It is normal to feel stressed as your teen develops. As they grow, your relationship changes. To handle this change smoothly, you must care for yourself.
text:
Kungokwemvelo

Kujwayelekile ukuzizwa une-stress ngesikhathi umntwana wakho isakhula. Ngesikhathi isakhula, ubudlelwane bakho buyashintsha. Ukuze ubhekane nalolu shintsho ngaphandle kokuphazamiseka, kufanele uzinakekele.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Khulula izingalo zakho uzidedele zilenge emaceleni, futhi ijike ngenhla yomzimba engaphezulu. Izingalo zakho kufanele zishaye umhlane wakho kancane njengoba ujikajikisa umzimba wakho.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olulodwa phambi kolunye bese ujikelezisa unyawo lwakho kusukela eqakaleni, lokhu ukwenze kuzo zombili izihlangothi. Unyawo ngalunye lujikelezise izikhathi ezine kulolo nakulolo hlangothi.

SourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Manje nyakazisa wonke umzimba ngokushesha kangangokunokwenzeka. Wunyakazise uye phezulu kakhulu! Wunyakazise uye phansi kakhulu! Unyakazisele yonke indawo!

SourceText: Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out, 4 more times.
text: Phakamisa futhi wehlise izingalo zakho, udonsa umoya futhi uwukhipha, izikhathi ezi-4 ezingeziwe.

SourceText: Well done! üéâ You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to stretch and move your body.

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Teens often struggle with identity and self-image as they figure out who they are and what they want to be.
text: üëÄ Akulungile. Intsha bavamise ukudideka mayelana nokuzazi nangendlela abazibona ngayo ngesikhathi besakhula nanokuthi bafuna ukuba ngabantu abanjani lapho sebekhulile.

SourceText: How can parents help their teens cope with mood swings during adolescence?
text: Abazali bangazisiza kanjani izumntwana zabo mayelana nokuthi zikwazi ukubhekana nendlela eguquguqukayo ezizizwa ngayo ngesikhathi zisakhula?

SourceText: Oops, try again. Parents can help by letting their teen know their feelings are okay and being there for them.

SourceText: You are right! Parents can help by listening to their teens, noticing their feelings, and being there for them.
text: Uqinisile! Abazali bangasiza ngokulalela abantwana babo abasebasha, babone imizwa yabo, futhi babeseduze.

SourceText: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
text: Kulesi isifundo, sizoqhubeka sifunde ngoshintsho umntwana wakho umntwana angabhekana nalo njengoba ekhula. Namhlanje, sizohlola ukushintsha komzimba. Lolushintsho luyinxenye yokufika ekukhuleni kwezocansi ebizwa ngokungena ezingeni lobudala.

SourceText: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for girls?
text: Yini ukungena ezingeni lobudala, futhi kujwayele ukuqala nini emantombazaneni?

SourceText: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
text: Uqinisile! Ukungena ezingeni lobudala ushintsho olwenzeka ezimbeni womuntu uma ezoba ngumuntu omdala. Emantombazaneni, kuqala eminyakeni ephakathi kwa-8 no-13.

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.

SourceText: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for girls?
text: Yiziphi izinguquko ezithile ezivamile zomzimba ezenzeka emantombazaneni ngesikhathi sokuthomba?

SourceText: Oops, try again. During puberty, girls go through a lot of physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ekungeneni ezingeni lobudala, amantombazane abanoshintsho lomzimba oluningi. Lokhu kubala amabele akhulayo, izinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, futhi baqala ukuba esikhathini.

SourceText: Correct! During puberty, girls undergo many physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.

SourceText: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for boys?
text: Yini ukungena ezingeni lobudala, futhi kujwayele ukuqala nini ebafaneni?

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For boys, puberty starts between ages 9 and 14.
text: üëÄ Eish, zama futhi! Ukuthomba ushintsho ezimbeni womuntu njengoba ekhula. Ebafaneni, kuqala eminyakeni ephakathi kwa-9 no-14.

SourceText: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for boys?
text: Yiluphi ushintsho oluvamile lomzimba okwenzeka ekungeneni ezingeni lobudala ebafaneni?

SourceText: Oops, try again. During puberty, boys go through a lot of physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala, amabafana babhekana noshintsho lomzimba oluningi. Lokhu kubala ukukhula kwamasende, ukukhula kwezinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, nokukhula ngobude.

SourceText: Correct! During puberty, boys undergo many physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
text: Uqinisile! Ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala, abafana bakhekana noshintsho lomzimba kakhulu. Lokhu kubala ukukhula kwamasende, ukukhula kwezinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, futhi nokukhula ngobude.

SourceText: How can parents support their sons during puberty?
text: Abazali bangaweseka kanjani amadodana abo ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala?

SourceText: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make boys feel better about growing up.
text: Uqinisile! Ukukhuluma ngokungena ezingeni lobudala kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize amadodana abo azizwe akhululekile futhi azethemba. Lokhu kungenza abafana bazizwe kangcono ngokukhula.

SourceText: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make sons feel better about growing up.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ukukhuluma ngokungena ezingeni lobudala kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize abadodana abo akhululeke futhi azethembe. Lokhu kungenze amadodana azizwe kangcono ngokukhula.

SourceText: Talking openly with @fields.child_nickname about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves.  Understanding the changes happening in the body can also help reduce stress around any big changes they experience.
text: Ukhuluma ukhululekile no@fields.child_nickname ngoshintsho abhekana nalo emzimbeni wakhe kungamusiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana nalolushintsho nokuzinakekela. Ukuqondisisa lolushintsho olwenzeka emzimbeni kungasiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana noshintsho olukhulu abhekana nalo.

SourceText: ‚è∏ Teens often do not want to speak to their parents about reproductive health, relationships, and sex.
text: ‚è∏ Intsha ngokuvamile ayifuni ukukhuluma nabazali bayo ngempilo yokuzala, ubudlelwano, nangocansi.

SourceText: üîÑ Share that it is normal and that you also went through this.
text: üîÑ Yabelana ngokuthi kujwayelekile nokuthi nawe udlule kukho.

SourceText: üå± If they do not want to talk to you, give them resources so they can learn about the topic, or guide them on who else they can talk to for reliable information and advice.
text: üå± Uma bengafuni ukukhuluma nawe, banikeze izinsiza ukuze bazifundele ngezihloko ezimayelana naleyo ndaba, noma ubasize bazi ukuthi ubani omunye abangakhuluma naye ukuze bathole ulwazi oluthembekile nezeluleko.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Tell your teen that you are happy to speak with them any time!
text: ‚≠ê Tshela ingane yakho ukuthi ukujabulele ukukhuluma nayo noma nini!

SourceText: üíõ It can be hard to find resources!
text: üíõ Kungaba nzima ukuthola izinsiza!

SourceText: Here are some resources to help you with supporting your teen's development:
text: Nanka amanye amathuluzi angakusiza ube nesandla endleleni ingane yakho esentsha ekhula ngayo:

SourceText: {development resources 1}
text: {izinsiza zokuthuthukisa 1}

SourceText: üíö We are sorry to hear that it has been hard to talk to your teen about sexual reproductive health, relationships, and sex.
text: üíö Siyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi kube nzima ukukhuluma nengane yakho mayelana nempilo yokuzala, ubudlelwano, kanye nocansi.

SourceText: üò£ Talking about reproductive health, relationships, and sex can be uncomfortable - many parents feel this way!
text: üò£ Ukukhuluma ngempilo yokuzala, ubudlelwano, kanye nocansi kungase kungakhululeki - abazali abaningi bazizwa ngale ndlela!

SourceText: üòÉ Remember, these are all normal parts of life.
text: üòÉ Khumbula, lezi yizingxenye ezijwayelekile zempilo.

SourceText: üå∑ The more you talk about these topics and educate @fields.child_nickname, the more prepared they are for keeping themselves healthy and safe.
text: üå∑Njengoba uqhubeka ukhuluma ngalezi zihloko futhi ufundisa @fields.child_nickname, bazoya ngokuya bekulungela ukuzigcina benempilo enhle futhi bephephile.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: üå∑ The more you talk about these topics and educate your teen, the more prepared they are for keeping themselves healthy and safe.
text: üå∑Njengoba uqhubeka ukhuluma ngalezi zihloko futhi ufundisa, bazoya ngokuya bekulungela ukuzigcina benempilo enhle futhi bephephile.

SourceText: ‚¨áÔ∏è Talking about relationships and sex from an early age reduces the chance that teens end up in dangerous or unhealthy situations!
text: ‚¨áÔ∏è Ukukhuluma ngobudlelwano kanye nocansi kusukela esemncane kunciphisa amathuba okuthi ingane igcine isezimeni eziyingozi noma ezingenampilo!

SourceText: üíö It means @fields.child_nickname knows what is safe and healthy, so they can make good choices to keep themselves safe.
text: üíö Kusho ukuthi @fields.child_nickname iyazi ukuthi yini ephephile futhi enempilo, ngakho zingenza izinqumo ezinhle ukuze zizigcine ziphephile.

SourceText: üíö It means your teen knows what is safe and healthy, so they can make good choices to keep themselves safe.
text: üíö Kusho ukuthi ingane yakho iyazi ukuthi yini ephephile futhi enempilo, ukuze bakwazi ukwenza izinqumo ezinhle ukuze bazigcine bephephile.

SourceText: What did you find difficult when supporting your child‚Äôs development?
text: Yini oyithole inzima lapho usekela intuthuko yomntwana wakho?

SourceText: üåà It is okay to feel that way. There are many small ways to spend time with your child!
text: üåà Kwamukelekile ukuzizwa kanjalo. Ziningi izindlela ezincane zokuchitha isikhathi nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: ‚è∞ You can interact with your child while doing something else. For example, you can ask your child to describe the colours and objects they see around them while you are walking together or travelling on a bus.
text: ‚è∞ Ungakwazi ukuxhumana nomntwana wakho ube wenza enye into eceleni. Ngokwesibonelo, ungacela umntwana wakho ukuthi achaze imibala nezinto aziyibonayo lapho nihamba ndawonye noma nigibele ibhasi.

SourceText: üòÉ Your child will appreciate the attention you are giving, even for a short while.
text: üòÉ Umntwana wakho uzokujabulela ukumnaka kwakho, ngisho noma ngabe yisikhashana nje.

SourceText: üò£ You may be hurt because your child does not want to spend time with you.
text: üò£ Kungase kukuzwise ubuhlungu ukuthi umntwana wakho akafuni ukuchitha isikhathi nawe.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Sometimes, your child just needs some time to start to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with your child.
text: ‚è∞ Ngesinye isikhathi, umntwana wakho udinga nje isikhathi ukuze aqale ukusebenzisana nawe. Kuyasiza ukuhlala uzolile, unesineke, futhi unomusa ngenkathi uzama ukuxhumana nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: üå± As children grow, they may want independence from you. That‚Äôs normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.
text: üå± Njengoba abantwana bekhula, bangase bafune ukuzimela. Kuvamile lokho! Ungabasekela ukuze bathole abangani ngokusekelwe kulokho abakuthandayo.

SourceText: üß∏ It must be hard to see your child getting injured or feeling sad often.
text: üß∏ Kunzima ukubona umntwana wakho elimala noma ezizwa edabukile njalo.

SourceText: üå∑Children learn and grow from making mistakes. It is an important part of child development. They will be safe as long as you are aware of their activities and you can prevent anything dangerous.
text: üå∑Izingane zifunda futhi zikhule ngokwenza amaphutha. Kuyingxenye ebalulekile yokukhula kwengane. Bazophepha uma nje uqaphela lokho abekwenzayo futhi ungakwazi ukuvimbela noma yini eyingozi.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Build your child‚Äôs confidence about what they do, what is important to them, and how they look so that they are comfortable trying new things.
text: ‚≠ê Yakha ukuzethemba kwengane yakho ngalokho ekwenzayo, okubalulekile kuyo, nendlela ebukeka ngayo ukuze ikhululeke ukuzama izinto ezintsha.

SourceText: üé® Encourage them to safely try out fun activities with other children or adults. Praise them when they do it well!
text: üé® Bakhuthaze ukuthi bazame ngokuphephile imisebenzi yokuzijabulisa nezinye izingane noma abantu abadala. Bancome lapho bekwenza kahle!

SourceText: üíö Let your child know that you trust them to be safe and follow the rules that you have set.
text: üíö Yazisa ingane yakho ukuthi uyayethemba ukuthi ingakwazi ukuphepha futhi ilandele imithetho oyibekele yona.

SourceText: ‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for children (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing or sharing.
text: ‚öΩ Imidlalo yokuncintisana ingaba nzima kumntwana wakho (kanye nakubantu abadala!) uma engakuthandi ukuhlulwa.

SourceText: üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your child about what winning well and losing well might look like.
text: üèÜ Uma esezolile, xoxa naye umntwana ngokuphumelela kahle nokuhlulwa kahle kusho ukuthini.

SourceText: üìù Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.
text: üìùPhakamisa eminye imisebenzi eningayenza ukuze nisebenzisane esikhundleni sokuqhudelana.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. üí°
text: Bhala u-{PLAY} ukuze uthole izinto ezimnandi eningazenza ndawonye. üí°

SourceText: üíô It is difficult when your child is expressing negative feelings, but this is common because your child is also learning to manage their emotions.
text: üíô Kunzima uma ingane yakho izwakalisa imizwa engemihle, kodwa lokhu kuvamile ngoba ingane yakho ifunda ukulawula imizwa yayo.

SourceText: üëÇ Listen to your child‚Äôs emotions and acknowledge them.
text: üëÇ Lalela imizwa yengane yakho futhi uyazise.

SourceText: üí° Ask your child what they or you can do to help them feel better, and give your child advice on what you think would work well.
text: üí° Buza ingane yakho ukuthi yini yona engayenza noma wena ongayenza ukuze uyisize izizwe ingcono, futhi nikeza ingane yakho iseluleko ngalokho ocabanga ukuthi kungasiza.

SourceText: üå± While it is tempting to solve your child‚Äôs problems immediately with what you think is best, it will not help them grow. Give them a chance to come up with their own ideas!
text: üå± Nakuba kulinga ukuxazulula izinkinga zengane yakho ngokushesha ngalokho ocabanga ukuthi kungcono kakhulu, lokho ngeke kuyisize ikhule. Banike ithuba lokuzixazululela besebenzisa imibono yabo!

SourceText: üíö We are sorry to hear that it has been hard for you to understand your child‚Äôs development.
text: üíö Siyaxolisa ukuzwa ukuthi bekunzima kuwe ukuqonda ukukhula kwengane yakho.
